content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the rail. From there, move right to the arete, then work up on the edges to top it out.
content.protection: A pad should work fine, the landing is flat and clear, there is however a small tree behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of El Patrón.

content.description:
Crazy Charly is a slight contrivance that is well worth the attention if strapped up on the boulder's other problems.

Sit start with hands matched on bumps at arete. From there, traverse left on flat edges to far arete, throw heel up, then work back right and up on opposite arete.

There is high dab potential, as there is a large rock beneath a portion of the problem.
content.protection: A pair of pads, there is a rock below part of the problem and tree behind it.
content.location: It climbs the north face of El Patrón.

content.description:
Corpus Dakota climbs a solid overhang over a perfect landing via springy movement.

Stand start with hands matched on the rail. From there, dyno with the right hand to a big edge at the arete, bump the left up to an edge on the face, then dyno to the lip with the left hand, match hands, throw a heel over, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine, the landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the far northern section of the boulder's east face.

content.description:
Chipocchio is a short, dynamic problem that climbs a solid overhang.

Stand start with hands matched on the edge five feet off the ground. From there, dyno to the edge, match hands on the shelf below the lip, then reach the bumps atop the boulder, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine, the landing is impeccable.
content.location: It climbs the east facing overhang of El Patrón.
